intro: Epilobium brevifolium subsp. trichoneurum, commonly known as the hairy willow herb, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, pink or reddish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, often calcareous soils and is often found in wet meadows and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and habitat restoration projects.
